This article is a part of a series where I go through teachyourselfcs. If you would like to start at the beginning start here.

INTRO
LECTURE
L01

Class starts by going over some sytax for Scheme. Most languages do simple operations the same way we learned in grade school (infix notation):
2 + 2 + 3
Scheme uses a different syntax where the operator is the always on the left (prefix notation) and you can add many numbers as you would like:
(+ 2 2 3)
Now lets say we want to do something like:
2 + 2 + 3 - 4
In Scheme you can simply nest operators:
(- (+ 2 2 3) 4)
